titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 33

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

msContents.summary:
6 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 33; Qurʾānic Text: Q 16:32-16:116; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 333 x 327mm; Script style: kūfī B.Ia/b.
The fragment Arabe 333 (b) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.
This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 33
Fragment: 16:34(32)–117(116).
6 fol. 327×333 mm (1.0?). Support: thick semitransparent parchment, rather dark. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: one quire consisting of three bifolia.
I: H1F H2F H3F / F4H F5H F6H.
Text layout: 264×277 mm (1.05) , 14 lines (fol. 1), 15 lines (fol. 2 and 5), 16 lines (fol. 3 и 4). Ruling: absent. Script: B Ia→b. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the ink of the main text. Vocalization: round red dots.
Verse markers: for individual verses – diagonal dashes in ink (type 1.1.4); for groups of 10 verses – concentric circles in ink, red and green paint (type 1.A.I); for the group of 100 verses – a rather primitive medallion in the shape of irregular five-pointed star with semi-circles between its beams, drawn in ink, red and green paint (fol. 5v).
Traces of old conservation: upper and lower margins are slightly trimmed.
Defects: stains of dirt; parchment damaged by the green color of the verse marker on fol. 5v; margin edges are irregular, probably damaged by fire; ink has partly peeled off on some of the pages.
Old accession numbers: A. 5 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–6v. Surah 16, verses 34(32)-117(116). Incipit: [ يقولون] سلام عليكم . Explicit: يفترون على ا[لله الكذب] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 333b(?) (BNF)"
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
